intro: Phyteuma charmelii, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Phyteuma charmelii is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
